DataElement.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Diagnostic Imaging Cervical Vertebra Thoracic Spinal Cord Curie Extension Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The curie extension score of the cervico-thoracic spine region using PET.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Positron Emission Tomography Diagnostic Imaging Cervical Vertebra Thoracic Spinal Cord Curie Extension Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered._Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation._Any one of the seven vertebrae that are caudal to the skull, denoted as C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6 or C7._The portion of the spinal cord located in the thoracic region._A score assigned to a Curie body segment to indicate the quantity of metastases.

When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.:Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Concepts.definition: Any one of the seven vertebrae that are caudal to the skull, denoted as C1, C2, C3, C4, C5, C6 or C7.
The portion of the spinal cord located in the thoracic region.
A score assigned to a Curie body segment to indicate the quantity of metastases.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A score assigned to a Curie body segment to indicate the quantity of metastases._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No metastatic sites within a segment.

Concepts.definition: No metastatic sites within a segment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One metastatic site within a segment.

Concepts.definition: One metastatic site within a segment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: More than one metastatic site within a segment.

Concepts.definition: More than one metastatic site within a segment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Diffuse involvement within a segment (>50% of the segment).

Concepts.definition: Diffuse involvement within a segment (>50% of the segment).
